tool.name: Shard Document
tool.description: Splits large markdown documents into smaller, organized files based on level 2 (default) sections
tool.objective: Split large markdown documents into smaller, organized files based on level 2 sections using @kayvan/markdown-tree-parser tool

llm.i: MANDATORY: Execute ALL steps in the flow section IN EXACT ORDER
DO NOT skip steps or change the sequence
HALT immediately when halt-conditions are met
Each action xml tag within step xml tag is a REQUIRED action to complete that step
Sections outside flow (validation, output, critical-context) provide essential context - review and apply throughout execution

critical-context.i: Uses `npx @kayvan/markdown-tree-parser` to automatically shard documents by level 2 headings and generate an index

step.title: Get Source Document
step.action: Ask user for the source document path if not provided already
Verify file exists and is accessible
Verify file is markdown format (.md extension)

action.if: file not found or not markdown

step.action: HALT with error message

step.title: Get Destination Folder
step.action: Determine default destination: same location as source file, folder named after source file without .md extension
Example: /path/to/architecture.md â†’ /path/to/architecture/
Ask user for the destination folder path ([y] to confirm use of default: [suggested-path], else enter a new path)
Use the suggested destination path
Use the custom destination path
Verify destination folder exists or can be created
Check write permissions for destination
HALT with error message

step.title: Execute Sharding
step.action: Inform user that sharding is beginning
Execute command: `npx @kayvan/markdown-tree-parser [source-document] [destination-folder]`
Capture command output and any errors
HALT and display error to user

step.title: Verify Output
step.action: Check that destination folder contains sharded files
Verify index.md was created in destination folder
Count the number of files created
HALT with error message

step.title: Report Completion
step.action: Display completion report to user including:
Inform user that sharding completed successfully

halt-conditions.i: HALT if npx command fails or produces no output files
